body.name: EXCALIBLADES Ultra Sharp 8" Damascus Chef's Knife Professional Japanese Quality VG10 Stainless Steel. Long-Lasting Sharpness, Easy Care, Ergonomic Handle. Ideal Kitchen Knives for Precise Cutting
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 12 mins
features: PROFESSIONAL CHEF KNIFE - Exquisitely beautiful and super sharp, the gorgeous damascus chef's knives will make your cooking experience divine. Excaliblades VG-10 knives have the combination of hardness, sharpness, handle quality, balance, and edge retention that cuts through the competition.

DURABLE ROCKWELL HARDNESS - The chef's knife is crafted from Damascus steel with a VG10 core. Originating from Japan, the VG-10 stainless steel has reinforced carbon and 67 layers to offer extraordinary durability. Legend says it was forged by Merlin holding it under the fire of the dragon's breath.

HIGH EDGE RETENTION - Our chefs knife professional has a high edge retention which keeps the blade safe and ultra sharp – sharp enough to cut through the fabric of time! Note: Please be careful not to slice open any blackholes while using this knife – we won't be responsible for any disasters.

REGAL CRAFTSMANSHIP - The damascus chef knife's G10 handle is rugged, light, and easy to operate. Plus, material is impervious to moisture and temperature changes, ensuring that the handle remains unscathed even in the most challenging quests. This knife is a perfect blend of style and function - Fit for your royal highness!

VERSATILE IN THE KITCHEN - Our damascus chef knife can cut, chop, dice, and slice any food item with ease. The blade of power can be used to cut vegetables, fruit, meat, and all the appendages of the black knight! The knife is packaged in a rustic wooden box - ready to accompany you on your next culinary adventure!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: EXCALIBLADES - We believe a good knife is more than just a tool, it is an extension of the cook's hand, and it can be used to create works of art. EXCALIBLADES - AN AMERICAN BRAND AS BIG AS THE LONE STAR STATE Excaliblades chef's knife is crafted from Damascus steel with a VG10 core. Originating from Japan, the VG-10 stainless steel has reinforced carbon and 67 layers to offer extraordinary durability. Legend says it was forged by Merlin holding it under the fire of the dragon's breath.

HIGH EDGE RETENTION UNBREAKABLE BLADE Our professional chef's knife has a high edge retention which keeps the blade safe and ultra sharp – sharp enough to cut through the fabric of time! Note: Please be careful not to slice open any blackholes while using this knife – we won't be responsible for any disasters.

REGAL CRAFTSMANSHIP The Damascus Chef knife's G10 handle is rugged, lightweight, and easy to operate. Plus, material is impervious to moisture and temperature changes, ensuring that the handle remains unscathed even in the most challenging quests. This knife is a perfect blend of style and function - Fit for your royal highness!

VERSATILE IN THE KITCHEN Our Damascus chef knife can cut, chop, dice, and slice any food item with ease. The blade of power can be used to cut vegetables, fruit, meat, and all the appendages of the black knight! The knife is packaged in a rustic wooden box - ready to accompany you on your next culinary adventure!

This is no ordinary kitchen knife - the Excaliblades professional kitchen knife is a work of art, with a Damascus steel blade and VG10 core that ensures superior edge retention. The blade length measures 8.25 inches, while the handle stretches 5.25"". It has an overall weight of 9 ounces (260 grams) and the blade width at its widest point is 2."" It's also beautifully designed, with a 61 HRC Rockwell Hardness that results in an incredibly sharp and durable blade. You don't have to worry about dicing, chopping and cutting those fruits, vegetables and even meat. The blade will stay sharp through even the most arduous prep work. The compelling Damascus steel blades are made from only the best materials and have been crafted with a special process to make them sharper, longer lasting than other contemporary carbon steel kitchen knives. These blades include Vanadium for superior corrosion resistance which will keep this knife extremely sharp over time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Blade Designed for Battle, Guaranteed to Slay Your Culinary Foes
reviews.reviewText: It's not every day you purchase a top-quality chef knife, so it's crucial to choose wisely.Upon receiving this treasure, you'll first encounter the attractive wooden box it's encased in, increasing the anticipation for the reveal. And what a reveal this is! The blade itself is gorgeous, with a very cool pattern. And the handle boasts a marble-esque design to die for.But, of course, none of this would matter if the knife's function fell slave to failure. And I can confirm that it most certainly does not. At our house, we enjoy making homemade shoestring fries, which can be difficult to cut with precision. Not with Excaliblades! The thickness of the blade is distributed well along the length of the knife. And it slices through the the thickest potatoes as if they were made solely of air. Yes, this sucker is SHARP.Like most high-end blades, this knife has some weight to it, but not enough to make it unwieldy. In fact, it takes little effort to use at all. As long as you use it safely, it could easily become your go-to blade for any meal prep. A comfortable thumb rest seals the deal.Fortunately, you don't have to be King Arthur to wield this blade—you only need to click "Buy Now."

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp, Well-Constructed, Gorgeous Packaging, Right-Priced
reviews.reviewText: Recommended! Very happy with this rock-solid Chef Knife. Delivery was fast, and packaging is beautiful. Bought one for myself, and will look to buy more as gifts in the near future. Watch out for those blackholes, because this baby is Sharp! Image is from my couch after opening the display-worthy wooden box. Love it. (C. Price)UPDATE - And here's a Review from the Excaliblade I sent to my Dad as a gift, because the Amazon system won't allow him to write his own review (because it was my purchase)."5 Stars - I received this knife as a gift and it is the sharpest knife I have ever experienced. I worked in my family's restaurant when I was young and I appreciate good knives. It also has a good feel and balance. Very impressive. (J.Price)"

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this thing. Beautifully packaged and so freaking sharp. I have never owned a knife I was worried to use Incase my hand slipped but this thing is amazingly sharp. It’s beautiful and the box it came in is awesome. Absolutely perfect for your starting chef or loved one that likes to cook! Absolutely recommend! I opened this before Christmas dinner so the pictures are from after but it still looks amazing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: FULL DISCLOSURE…..I bought this knife because the sellers are friends of mine, and I wanted to support them. WELL…..I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the knife. Everything from the box it comes in, to the handle, to the steel used for the blade is top notch. Fantastic craftsmanship. I like to cook a lot, and this will be my new “go to” knife. Feel very comfortable in my hand and it’s SUPER well balanced. Very nice. I would buy this again, even if I didn’t know the sellers. 😂

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Taco prep JUGGERNAUT
reviews.reviewText: I saw this knife on a cooking channel, Drunken Migos, and saw how easily the host was able to slice through a cardboard box like it was nothing. He also took the knife and cut razor thin slices of the box and immediately I had to research the knife myself. I own a taco catering business outside of Chicago and I do all of my own prep work. Well I had my last even of the season this past Saturday and decided to put this knife through the ringer. Keep in mind that out of the box this bad boy glides through paper and sliced a tomato like butter. I cut up about 50 avocados, 3 red onions, 12 bunches of cilantro, 6 white onions, 3 yellow onions and like 15 jalapeños…then once I was done I ran the knife through the paper/tomato test again and same out of the box sharpness. I purchased the knife so this is a god honest review. If you’re looking for a handsome looking blade that performs as good as it looks then do yourself a favor and order it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Sharpe knife! Comfortable to use! Great price, excellent quality

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The Excaliblade shines like the light of 30 torches as soon as you take it out of the wooden box in which it’s delivered. It’s immediately comfortable in your hand, light, razor thin and very sharp. It is so sharp that if I am ever in a horror movie, and I have to grab a knife to defend myself from the killer, this is the life that I am grabbing. I have been using this knife for a while now, putting it through all of its pieces in the kitchen, and it cuts like a dream. If this blade truly had “throw me away” on one side and “take me in” on the other, I would definitely be taking it in because it’s worth every penny that I paid for it. My advice is to put it in Ye Olde Amazon cart and buy it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I won’t lie I had super high hopes for this knife… considering it had 5/5 stars even with 27 reviews that’s is still extremely good. Sadly I am going to have to be the one to bring that from a 5.0 down to a 4. Something because I can’t with good conscious lie in a review.I just purchased a set of 3 Damascus knives, and the full set was cheaper than this 1 knife alone; and immediately upon opening, this knife actually underperformed. I looks beautiful and the quality of it is excellent. But it was not nearly as sharp as I was expecting. I tried to cut an orange and it was pretty good. Then I tried to cut and apple and was actually kind of struggling to get it to slice through, I actually have to push down hard to get it to cut through. Then yesterday I was cutting some chicken breasts, and this knife was giving me a lot of resistance and did not at all give me the “smooth like butter” cut I was highly anticipating, and when I was trying to dice up some sundered tomatoes out of the jar the knife wasn’t cutting like at all and I actually ended up just breaking them apart with my fingers because I was so frustrated at how poorly my knife was performing.
